name: prunus-persica-fantasia
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: It produces large-sized, freestone fruit. It features a red skin and yellow firm flesh. Excellent quality and productive. It is also quite cold-hardy. Ripens in mid-season.
flower-description: The five-petal, solid or paired pink flowers bloom early in spring, before leaf sprouts.
leaf-description: The leaves are lanceolate shaped, 3-6 inches in length and 0.8-1.2 inches broad. Pinnately veined.
poison-symptoms:
The pits contain cyanide compounds, which are poisonous. If a couple of pits are accidentally swallowed, it will not cause poisoning. The pits are more poisonous if they are ground up/crushed or the seeds are chewed. Fruit that has not been pitted should not be blended into a smoothie.
Symptoms include Gasping, weakness, excitement, pupil dilation, spasms, convulsions, coma, respiratory failure.
